dcterms:creator: F. J. Garcia-Vidal
L. Martin-Moreno
T. W. Ebbesen
L. Kuipers
dcterms:description: The Coupled Mode Theory (CMT) framework is used to simulate transmission and extraordinary optical transmission phenomena in various systems, providing accurate results with minimal computational cost.
dcterms:title: Coupled Mode Theory (CMT) framework

dcterms:creator: L. Ardizzone
J. Kruse
C. Lüth
N. Bracher
C. Rother
U. Köthe
dcterms:description: The FrEIA framework is utilized for implementing Conditional Invertible Neural Networks (cINNs) to tackle multimodal device distributions in inverse photonic design.
dcterms:title: FrEIA framework

dcterms:description: A training set consisting of 60,000 different structures used for training the neural networks in the study.
dcterms:title: Training set of 60,000 different structures

dcterms:description: The spectral response of the device is analyzed and simulated to match the desired transmission spectrum.
dcterms:title: Spectral response of the device

dcterms:description: A vector representing the parameters of the device used in the simulations.
dcterms:title: Device parameter vector

dcterms:description: A validation set used to benchmark the performance of the cINN against the cVAE.
dcterms:title: Validation set

dcterms:creator: D. P. Kingma
M. Welling
dcterms:description: Generative models including Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) and Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are discussed as methods for modeling multimodal distributions in inverse design.
dcterms:title: Generative models including Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) and Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)

dcterms:creator: S. So
J. Rho
dcterms:description: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are explored for designing nanophotonic structures.
dcterms:title: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
